alert.note: Alert for Pine Ridge, Nebraska National Forest (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 01 at 2:47PM CDT until November 01 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM MDT TODAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR WEDNESDAY NOON TO 6 PM FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... The Fire Weather Watch remains in effect Wednesday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 434 in the northern Nebraska Panhandle and fire weather zones 417 and 418 in east-central Wyoming. * WIND...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. Similar if not stronger winds expected Wednesday. * HUMIDITY...Around 15 percent both today and Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop may spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
